description: This file defines a Dart class 'ResponsiveBreakpoints' that provides static methods and constants to determine screen size categories (small, medium, large) based on device width and to retrieve responsive values accordingly, typically used in Flutter apps for UI responsiveness.

classes.name: ResponsiveBreakpoints
classes.description: Provides static methods and constants for determining device breakpoint categories and responsive value selection based on screen width.

methods.name: isSmall
methods.description: Checks if the device width is less than the smallMaxWidth threshold, indicating a small screen such as typical phones.

methods.name: isMedium
methods.description: Checks if the device width falls between smallMaxWidth and mediumMaxWidth, indicating a medium-sized device like large phones or tablets in portrait.

methods.name: isLarge
methods.description: Checks if the device width is greater than or equal to mediumMaxWidth, indicating a large device.

methods.name: value
methods.description: Returns a value based on the current device size category, with optional different values for small, medium, and large screens.
